pull.title: refactor: Drop noop gcc version checks
pull.body: Since #20413 the minimum required GCC version is 7.

events.body:
I think these are included in #19183. Also, unless we added that check, I'm not sure if we want to modify nanobench.

Edit: Saying that. #19183 is being split up/possibly blocked, so if the nanobench change is removed, I don't mind if this is merged earlier.

rename.to: refactor: Drop noop gcc version checks

events.body:
I'm not sure this is correct, or at-least, now that this is only using `__has_builtin()` for the builtin checks, they wont be defined for GCC < 10, as that was the first version to get [`__has_builtin()`](https://gcc.gnu.org/gcc-10/changes.html).
> New built-in functions: 
> The __has_builtin built-in preprocessor operator can be used to query support for built-in functions provided by GCC and other compilers that support it.

Is that the desired behavior? I assume that's why it also has a check for `__GNUC__`.

i.e:

```cpp
#include <iostream>

int main() {
#if defined(__has_builtin)
        std::cout << "has __has_builtin()\n";
#endif
        return 0;
}
```

```bash
g++ --version
g++ (Ubuntu 9.3.0-17ubuntu1~20.04) 9.3.0

g++ test.cpp && ./a.out
# not avaliable

g++-10 test.cpp && ./a.out
has __has_builtin()
```

> I'm not sure this is correct, or at-least, now that this is only using `__has_builtin()` for the builtin checks, they wont be defined for GCC < 10, as that was the first version to get [`__has_builtin()`](https://gcc.gnu.org/gcc-10/changes.html).

Updated ([reverted back](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20491#discussion_r532107913)).

issue.title: refactor: Drop noop gcc version checks
issue.body:
Ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20491

Our minimum GCC version is 7.  Additionallly, `IS_TRIVIALLY_CONSTRUCTIBLE` does not appear to be in our codebase.

issue.title: Backports 15747, 15532, 14556, 14594, 15136, 20491, 14715
issue.body:
#14715 moves around a gcc4.8 specific fix, which is removed in #20491, but #20491 also removes some gcc5 specific code from the not yet backported #18565 and #18353 so it is partial.

#15136: The change makes it look a tad worse imo, but it makes it possible to see all the info at 800x600 with scrollbars. It could look better if the ScrollArea used the same style as its surroundings instead of the tan background, but I'm not sure how to do that.

Partial #15747: Makes small missed changes to #14957 (VM_Staged). Also, I can make analagous changes for the dash specific Get*Balance functions if that sounds like a good addition.

comments.body:
isn't this covered by the previous check already?

https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc-7.1.0/gcc/Integer-Overflow-Builtins.html
